conclusion: Analyze the graph of acceleration as a function of displacement.
Acceleration is constant and equal to a_0 from x = 0 to x = x_1, then decreases linearly to 0 at x = x_3.
Acceleration a is constant and equal to a_0 from x = 0 to x = x_1.
Relationship between velocity v and acceleration a is given by v = ∫ a dx.
Velocity v as a function of x is v = ∫ a_0 dx = a_0 x + C.
Initial condition: at x = 0, velocity v = 0 since the object is initially at rest.
Velocity as a function of x is v = a_0 x.
At x = x_1, the velocity is v = a_0 x_1.
The magnitude of the object's velocity when the displacement is x_1 is a_0 x_1.
